column1: Literature has something for every hour
column3: every circumstance. It may be that there is one little vacant chair in this family circle
column4: or that from some neighbor's family a child has gone. Fear clutches at the youthful hearts and Grief shudders behind each chair. Even the warm bed in the dark room is a dread
column5: for we have so surrounded death with mystery and terror that even the young are aghast when it is mentioned. But our best-loved poet has a cheering message for every one
column6: and into this little group the parent brings it. In soft and sympathetic voice he reads aloud
column7: giving the slow and gentle music of the lines time to steal into the youthful hearts.As he reads
column8: he pauses now and then to speak to his little audience
column9: watching ever not to be sharp in his questionings or anything but kindly in his comments.
